greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of f(-q^3)^2 * Q(q^3) + 48 * q * f(-q^3)^10 in powers of q.
comment: f(-q) (g.f. A010815) and Q(q) (g.f. A004009) are Ramanujan q-series.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2500
formula: G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (144 t)) = 12^5 (t/i)^5 f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t).

a(n) = b(4*n + 1) where b() is multiplicative with b(2^e) = b(3^e) = 0^e, b(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e) / 2 * p^(2*e) if p == 7 or 11 (mod 12), b(p^e) = b(p) * b(p^(e-1)) - p^4 * b(p^(e-2)) if p == 1 or 5 (mod 12).
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A, B); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); B = 64 * x^3 * (eta(x^12 + A) / eta(x^3 + A))^8; polcoeff( 48 * x * eta(x^3 + A)^10 + (1 + 4*B + B^2) * eta(x^3 + A)^18 / eta(x^6 + A)^8, n))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jan 06 2014
